column1: Data Supplied By: National Livestock Reporting Service
Data source: National Livestock Reporting Service
Please see terms of use here: https://www.mla.com.au/general/Terms-and-conditions/data-and-information/

A smaller yarding of 1,000 head was yarded for the Blackall prime sale this week. The majority of the yarding was made up of prime cows and heavy grown steers alongside one large consignment of heavy feeder steers. All the usual export buyers were present and operating and there was strong competition from local restockers for feeder cattle.

A limited number of mixed quality light weight restocker steers and heifers were on offer with the top price of 352.2c for steers 280 to 330kg and heifers of the same weight sold to 260.2c/kg.  A large run of vendor bred heavy feeder steers were a standout selling to 360.2c/kg.

Heavy grown steers to the processor sold to 312.2c to average 305c, Grown heifers to the processor sold to an isolated 320.2c wth most around 285c and local and southern restockers were active on light condition  cows selling to 246.2c averaging 214c/kg. Medium weight cows topped at 265.2c to average 252c, good heavy cows sold to 280.2c averaging 271c and heavy bulls sold to 258.2c/kg.
Market reporter,
Sam Hart
